Articles.Content:
One more thing: What are gendered docking ports?

They're docking ports that consist of two different parts. One part on one ship, the different part on another.

Already experienced 2 crashes.

Gee gee

They're docking ports that consist of two different parts. One part on one ship, the different part on another.

At the risk of sounding stupid why are those any more useful than regular docking ports?

At the risk of sounding stupid why are those any more useful than regular docking ports?

They're not, as far as I can tell from reading the patch notes, they're an optional option in the part configs for part-makers, so they don't need to make their own module to make gendered docking ports.

I don't think there's any gendered docking ports that are stock, just an option implemented in the stock "part module" for add-on developers.
But, but, Fallout 4 releases tonight! I need to get sleep sometime this week.

Hmm if you transfer the pilot of the Velociteze to the MK1 crew cabin you can't go IVA and when you press the button for it it locks up the camera and stuff, you need to go to the map and exit it to reset, and when you transfer the pilot back to the MK1 cockpit the facecam doesn't reappear, with pressing the IVA button doing the same as above. Fresh reinstall for the update.

Update is good apart from that(it was literally the first thing I done in the updated game ) ^.^

So I just spent a half hour reading the fix list whilst steam updated... Looks great! Looking forward to running it. Hoping that the mods are not too adversely affected...

Danny
Gendered docking ports was a modder request. We do tend to do them from time to time.

Wooooooo hooooooo!

I'm glad to see the Emergency Braking Thrusters fired at the appropriate time, even though I wasn't awake at the cab of the engine in time. I really do wish I had been there to give the train a more comfortable stop. I will definitely be playing the heck out of the update!
There's a misspelling in the description of the Dynawing. "Convectional" should be "conventional".
Hmm, the Thud is a lot flatter now... I like it.
Looks like a significant update. For me, relative small changes like changed bouyancy (hope I didn't spelled this wrong) and small jet engines have a rather large positive impact on the game.

Already experienced 2 crashes.

Gee gee

If you can reproduce these, please submit a bug report to the support forum with logs of the crash and a description of what you were doing at the time of the crash.

ok, I think I found a problem with one of the fixes... Sorry guys - I hate to be that guy...

So I launched a little space station the other day with tons of docking ports, including some connected to station service modules that I will keep around most of the time. Here's what the update did with all of those newly-stageable docking ports:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Note how they all got added to my first stage, so if I were Kerbal enough to just slap my spacebar, the station would fly apart and I would get the joy of reassembling it...

Danny
I rolled back to 1.04 till all of my mods catch up. But doesnt mean I am any less excited.

Gendered docking ports was a modder request. We do tend to do them from time to time.

The first time I read that I near spit soda all over my work station.

YESS!! Airplane cockpits start with NO monoprop!

EDIT:

I actually may be wrong. Forgot I was using a stock craft.

Oh man. SO much new modding potential. Toggle-able cannot-activate-while-stowed, gendered docking ports, and more! Also, toggle-able staging on docking ports and decouplers. AWESOME!

- - - Updated - - -

Oh yeah, plane parts. Those too.

Note how they all got added to my first stage, so if I were Kerbal enough to just slap my spacebar, the station would fly apart and I would get the joy of reassembling it...

Danny

Right click them and remove them from staging, you can do this with regular decouplers, too.

I have to say, the Vector engine is great, although it may be slightly overpowered. At least you can slap a Shuttle replica together in 2 minutes with just a dozen stock parts right now (a couple of orange tanks, two Kickbacks and a bog standard orbiter will do that trick).

Only thing I found a bit disappointing was the fact that the Thud model was revamped (it looks good now), but it's still marginally useless since it's an LF/O engine. It would be better as a complement to the Vector with Monoprop fuel, so it is equivalent to the shuttle's OMS. It *looks* like an OMS now, so why not make it *act* like one?

Submarines, now a thing:

Emergency surface!

(Did not end well)

Edited November 9, 2015 by Red Iron Crown
Is the IntakeAir number supposed to be maxed/near even though the intake flow is dropping to near 0 and the engines are flamed out?

Gendered docking ports was a modder request. We do tend to do them from time to time.

Especially just after several modders get taken on as devs...

Seriously though, great job on the update, Squad. Now I've just got to find some spare time to update a few mods...

Right click them and remove them from staging, you can do this with regular decouplers, too.

I could have sworn I read that you could do that, but there's no option to remove them from staging. Maybe it's only in the editor?

Danny
the hype train has stopped at 1.0.5, the next destination. 1.1!!!!
